page.title: 12HOLME VALLEY INDUSTRY - 2
page.content: The years since World War Two have seen a rapid{decline in the wool {textile industry.}Reasons for this include the increased use of man made fibres and cheaper foreign imports. There is much evidence of this decline in the valley. Some mills lie empty and others have been demolished. Some however, have been re-occupied by new industries. Two of the larger examples of this, in Brockholes and Honley respectively, are{electric motor}and {soft drinks}production. There are also two examples of the current trend towards small businesses housed in{factory or workshop 'units'. In Honley these are in old converted mills. In Brockholes a small estate of units is under construction (July 85) on the site of a cleared textile mill. One firm makes{electrically 'boosted' {bicycles}drawing national attention.
